page.title: 04Homelife-Ringland & Taverham
page.content: {'Ringland}is a peaceful village about 7 miles from Norwich.There is a river nearby where we can fish and swim. There is a pub and a P.O. and a church. On the valley's south side lie {Ringland Hills}where we can sledge. There are 2 commons and on the bottom one are some horses. There used to be many clubs in{Ringland,}but bingo is the only one left.'(Catherine Tointon) 'I get up at 7.45, have some breakfast of toast or cereal, wash, clean my teeth and make my bed by pulling up my quilt. I get dressed, tidy up and read until 8.50 when I cycle to school which starts at 9.00 and finishes at 3.00. When I get home, I play with my friends and at 5.30 I have tea (eg sausage, chips & peas) & watch TV. At 6.30 I go to a gym club in Norwich, come home at 10.00, clean my teeth and go to bed.'(Anna Baker.)
